# Concept: <name>
This concept doc explains what the idea is and why it exists.
Use it to build shared understanding across roles and teams.
Keep the language descriptive and stable over time.
Avoid procedural steps or implementation detail.

## What it is
Describe the concept in plain, concrete terms.
Include the core boundaries that keep it distinct.

- Core definition in one sentence.
- Key boundary that keeps scope clear.
- Primary audience or consumer.

> EXAMPLE: "<Concept> is the shared contract for <domain> inputs and outputs."

## Why it exists
Explain the motivation behind the concept.
Focus on the outcomes it enables or the risk it reduces.

- Outcome the concept unlocks.
- Risk or cost the concept reduces.

## Key properties
List the properties that must remain true for the concept.

- Property that defines identity.
- Property that defines limits.
- Property that defines expected behavior.

## Related concepts
Call out neighboring concepts without describing processes.

- Related concept that interacts with this one.
- Related concept that is explicitly separate.

## Out of scope
State what this concept does not cover.

- Excluded feature or behavior.
- Excluded stakeholder need.
